attributes.comment:
Re: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services - docket number USCIS-2006- 0044

Currently, an adoption from China requires a family to submit the I600-A twice due
to the current and increasing wait times. The fee increase suggested would be
doubled for these families. Submitting the I600-A to adopt a child internationally is
no longer a one time occurrence. These families are also having to be re-
fingerprinted between 2 to 3 times during their wait for a child (which is expected
to lengthen). This means that in order for these families to adopt a child from
China the I600-A process will cost them between $1660 to $1820 under the
proposed increase. Please reconsider raising fees for these families.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Stephanie Pollara
